Name: Potion

Name: Sacred Ash

Description: A spray-type medicine. It awakens a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

Name: Antidote

Name: Paralyze Heal

Name: Full Heal

Name: Max Revive
Description: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It fully restores the Pokémon's HP.

Name: Berry Juice

Name: Max Honey

Name: PP Up

Name: PP Max

Description: It kinda looks cool.

Name: Ultra Ball
Description: An ultra-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a Great Ball.

Name: Great Ball
Description: A good
high-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball.

Name: Poké Ball
Description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It is thrown like a ball at the target. It is designed as a capsule system.

Name: Safari Ball
Description: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Safari Zone. It is decorated in a camouflage pattern.

Name: Sport Ball
Description: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

Name: Net Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Water- and Bug-type Pokémon.

Name: Dive Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon that live underwater.

Name: Nest Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on weaker Pokémon in the wild.

Name: Repeat Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that were previously caught.

Name: Timer Ball
Description: A somewhat different Ball that becomes progressively better the more turns there are in a battle.

Name: Luxury Ball
Description: A comfortable Poké Ball that makes a caught wild Pokémon quickly grow friendly.

Name: Premier Ball
Description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

Name: Dusk Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves.

Name: Heal Ball
Description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the caught Pokémon's HP and eliminates any status problem.

Name: Quick Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that provides a better catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

Name: Cherish Ball
Description: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

Name: Fast Ball
Description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch fast Pokémon.

Name: Level Ball
Description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are a lower level than your own.

Name: Lure Ball
Description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

Name: Heavy Ball
Description: A Poké Ball for catching very heavy Pokémon.

Name: Love Ball
Description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

Name: Friend Ball
Description: A Poké Ball that makes caught Pokémon more friendly.

Name: Moon Ball
Description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

Name: Dream Ball
Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon while they're asleep.

Name: Beast Ball
Description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

Name: TM01
Description: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.

Name: TM02
Description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

Name: TM03
Description: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.

Name: TM04
Description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

Name: TM05
Description: The target is scared off
and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild
this ends the battle.

Name: TM06
Description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.

Name: TM07
Description: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.

Name: TM08
Description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

Name: TM09
Description: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.

Name: TM10
Description: The user attacks with a barrage of magical leaves.

Name: TM11
Description: The user intensifies the sun for five turns
powering up Fire-type moves and weakening Water-type moves.

Name: TM12
Description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

Name: TM13
Description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.

Name: TM14
Description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave them frozen.

Name: TM15
Description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can't move on the next turn.

Name: TM16
Description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.

Name: TM17
Description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: TM18
Description: Deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage.

Name: TM19
Description: The user summons a heavy rain for five turns
powering up Water-type moves and weakening Fire-type ones.

Name: TM20
Description: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.

Name: TM21
Description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.

Name: TM22
Description: In this two-turn attack
the user gathers light
then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.

Name: TM23
Description: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

Name: TM24
Description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: TM25
Description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave them with paralysis.

Name: TM26
Description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

Name: TM27
Description: The user makes a swift attack on the target's legs
which lowers the target's Speed stat.

Name: TM28
Description: The user burrows into the ground
then attacks on the next turn. It can also be used to exit dungeons.

Name: TM29
Description: Deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage.

Name: TM30
Description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: TM31
Description: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers
such as Light Screen and Reflect.

Name: TM32
Description: By moving rapidly
the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

Name: TM33
Description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.

Name: TM34
Description: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.

Name: TM35
Description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: TM36

burned

Name: TM59

Sp. Def

Name: TR16
Description: After making its attack

Name: TR17

Name: TR18

Name: TR21

Name: TR22

Name: TR24

Name: TR25
Description: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: TR26
Description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

Name: TR35

Name: TR36
Description: The user exhales a heated breath to attack. It may also inflict a burn.

Name: TR37
Description: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: TR85

Name: TR100
Description: The user sends a distracting orb of light to confuse the target.

Name: TR05
Description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. It may also freeze the target solid.

Name: TR06
Description: Power doubles if opponent's HP is less than 50%.

Name: TR07
Description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team's feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

Name: HM01
Description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. This can also be used to cut down thin trees.

Name: HM02
Description: The user soars and then strikes on the next turn. This can also be used to fly to any familiar town.

Name: HM03

Description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. This can also be used to move heavy boulders.

Name: HM06
Description: The user attacks with a punch that may lower the target's Defense stat.

Description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

Name: Poké Toy
Description: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

Name: Bicycle

Name: Old Rod

Name: Good Rod
Description: A new
good-quality fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Name: Super Rod
Description: An awesome
high-tech fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Name: Itemfinder

Name: Dowsing Machine
Description: It checks for unseen items in the area and makes noise and lights when it finds something.

Name: Poké Radar
Description: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

Name: Town Map
Description: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows your present location.

Name: Escape Rope
Description: A long
durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

Name: Point Card
Description: A card that shows your trainer point amount.

Name: Poké Flute
Description: A flute that is said to instantly awaken any Pokémon. It has a lovely tone.

Name: Soot Sack
Description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

Name: Silph Scope

Name: Devon Scope
Description: A device by Devon that signals any unseeable Pokémon.

Name: Squirt Bottle

Name: Sprayduck

Name: Wailmer Pail

Name: Sprinklotad

Name: Gracidea

Name: Auspicious Armor
Description: A peculiar set of armor that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Auspicious wishes live within it.

Name: Mystery Spine
Description: The fossilized spine of an ancient Pokemon.

Name: Malicious Armor
Description: A peculiar set of armor that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Malicious will lurks within it.

Name: Scroll of Darkness
Description: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of darkness.

Name: Scroll of Waters
Description: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of water.

Name: Leader's Crest
Description: A shard of what appears to be an old blade of some sort. It is held only by Bisharp that head up a group of Pawniard.

Name: Booster Energy
Description: An item to be held by Pokémon with certain Abilities. It boosts the strength of the Pokémon.

Name: Ability Shield
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This  shield protects the holder from having its Ability changed by others.

Name: Clear Amulet
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It protects the holder from having its stats lowered by moves or Pokémon's Abilities.

Name: Mirror Herb
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This herb will allow the holder to mirror an opponent's stat increases-but only once.

Name: Punching Glove
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the holder's punching moves and prevents direct contact with targets.

Name: Covert Cloak
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It conceals the holder
protecting it from the additional effects of moves.

Name: Loaded Dice
Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It ensures the holder's multistrike moves hit more times.

Name: Gimmighoul Coin
Description: An item that accidentally dropped by a Pokémon. It seems that Gimmighoul treasure and hoard these.

Name: Tera Orb
Description: Allows Pokémon to Terastallize.

Name: Tera Orb
Description: An orb that holds the power to crystallize. When charged
it allows Pokémon to Terastallize.

Name: Mystery Tera Jewel
Description: A mostly in-tact Tera Jewel. Its awkward shape makes it hard to tell what Tera Type it may unlock.

Name: Master Tera Jewel
Description: A perfectly hexogonal Tera Jewel. Using this can unlock any Tera Type that the user desires.

Name: Radiant Tera Jewel
Description: A jewel glistening with Tera energy. It can fully recharge your Tera Orb in battle.

Name: Infinite Repel
Description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing. Can be toggled on and off

Name: Infinite Repel (Off)
Description: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing. Can be toggled on and off

Name: Gene Charm
Description: A charm said to increase the chance of finding Wild Pokémon with better genes.

Name: Heritage Charm
Description: A chiming charm said to increase the chance of finding Wild Pokémon with an Egg Move.

Name: Step Charm
Description: A warm charm said to decrease the amount of steps needed to hatch an egg.

Name: Friendship Charm
Description: A calming charm said to increase the friendship of Pokémon.

Name: Healing Charm
Description: A charm that doubles potion strength and restores HP while walking.

Name: Clover Charm
Description: A charm said to increase the probability of wild pokemon holding items.

Name: Gold Charm
Description: A charm said to increase gold gained from Trainer battles by 50%.

Name: Data Cable
Description: An odd looking cable cord. Doesn't look like it fits into any electronic I've seen.

Name: Misty Dew
Description: A foggy orb to be held by Morphias or Morphios. It boosts the holder's spatk and spdef by 1.5x during Misty Terrain
once per battle.

Description: This warm feather reflects the sun's rays in its plumage
a certain Pokemon would love this item.

Name: Dark Feather

a certain Pokémon would love this item.

Name: Berry Pots
Description: Handy containers for cultivating Berries wherever you go.

Name: Shattered Disk
Description: This disk fills you with a feeling of uncertainty
it's likely not from this world. A certain Pokemon might react strongly to it..
